content.rendered:
The Hear for Life Partner Program brings leading companies together with HLAA to promote hearing health and encourage more Americans to act on their hearing. By joining HLAA as a corporate partner, we extend our collective reach and impact. Together, we will grow our hearing health constituency.

Hearing health is finally beginning to get the attention it deserves nationally. And we have an unprecedented opportunity to do even more. By working with our corporate partners to provide vital tools and engagement, more people can and will live well with their hearing loss.

We invite you to team with us to empower more Americans to Hear for Life.

We’re better together as partners for hearing health. HLAA develops and takes part in awareness campaigns, provides online learning and support and advocates – nationally and in states – for the rights and needs of people with hearing loss. We have 120 chapters and state organizations, members and volunteers, hearing care professionals, nonprofit alliances and coalition partners in our network.

We have multiple opportunities for companies to engage with us including online and in-person events like our webinar and virtual meeting series, annual Convention and Walk4Hearing, a nationwide campaign that promotes hearing health in cities across the country while providing support and funding for essential community resources.

We inform people through Hearing Life quarterly magazine (currently with 5,000 subscribers), twice monthly Hearing Life e-News (18,000 subscribers), our website (with 2 million views per year and 45,000+ visitors per month) and social media and blog posts.

HLAA works with our valued partners to deliver vital programs that directly benefit people with hearing loss and their families.

Walk4Hearing

Walk4Hearing is the only nationwide event bringing attention to hearing loss and promoting the importance of hearing health.

Since 2006, the Walk4Hearing has raised $17.5 million to fund programs from more than 2,000 alliance organizations. We’ve welcomed 110,000 people at 304 Walks with participation from over 800 HLAA Chapter and State Organizations.

Learn more
